definition: magpie
former times/the past/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
surname Xi
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis
(bird species of China) Eurasian magpie (Pica pica)
magpie bridge across the Milky Way between Altair and Vega where Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女 are allowed an annual meeting
秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
the magpie made a nest, the turtledove dwells in it (idiom)/to reap where one has not sown
(bird species of China) Indochinese green magpie (Cissa hypoleuca)
(bird species of China) ratchet-tailed treepie (Temnurus temnurus)
(bird species of China) rufous treepie (Dendrocitta vagabunda)
(bird species of China) azure-winged magpie (Cyanopica cyanus)
(bird species of China) grey treepie (Dendrocitta formosae)
lit. sparrow and swallow, crow and magpie; fig. any Tom, Dick or Harry/a bunch of nobodies
(bird species of China) white-winged magpie (Urocissa whiteheadi)
(bird species of China) white-rumped shama (Copsychus malabaricus)
(bird species of China) racket-tailed treepie (Crypsirina temia)
(bird species of China) red-billed blue magpie (Urocissa erythroryncha)
(bird species of China) Taiwan blue magpie (Urocissa caerulea)

sentences.english: " These birds call fly and sing, "says Baby Magpie.
sentences.chinese: “这些鸟儿能够色行，还能歌唱，”鹊宝宝说。

sentences.english: The magpies were chattering in the trees.
This is then followed in the first person with a response from the magpie.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是以鹊为第一人称写作。

sentences.english: The winter go, crisp rust dance, magpie song branches.
sentences.chinese: 冬去春留，酥锈舞，鹊歌枝头。

sentences.english: They sat all in a row, like magpies on a fence.
sentences.chinese: 三个人坐成一排，象是停在栅栏上的鹊儿。

definition: oriole or various birds of the Sylvidae family including warblers
variant of 鶯|莺[ying1]
wild goose
variant of 雁[yan4]
heron
variant of 啼[ti2]
to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
a freckle/lentigo
small bird/sparrow/also pr. [qiao3]
old variant of 鳧|凫[fu2]
mallard/Anas platyrhyncha
see 徘徊[pai2 huai2], to dither/to hesitate/to pace back and forth/irresolute
to fly fast
partridge/Francolinus chinensis
anxious/grasshopper/a cricket
parrot
railing/balustrade/door-screen/exhausted/late
to be a noise in the world/to acquire notoriety

nymphalid/butterfly
